items.title: ICT Officer (SAP MM Configurator) - Home based at UNOPS
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=22, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=5}
items.content:
ICT Officer (SAP MM Configurator) - Home based

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level
Industry: Government, Public Affairs
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Public
Company: UNOPS – No office location

Technologies

sap
siebel

Job description

Background Information - Job-specific:Office of Information and Communications Technology (OICT) / Enterprise Application Centre- Asia (EAC-Asia).

In 2014 the Enterprise Application Centre- Asia (EAC-Asia) was established to serve as Asia-Pacific hub to build enterprise applications for the United Nations Secretariat. 

The staff being located both in New York and Bangkok, EAC-Asia oversees the development and maintenance of enterprise applications such as iNeed Customer Relationship Management system (iNeed), Electronic Fuel Management System 2 (eFMS-2), Electronic Contingency-Owned Equipment (eCOE), and Electronic Rations Management System (eRMS) among others.

Core enterprise application solutions have been built upon Siebel CRM public sector, Oracle-based identity management systems, JEE Spring Framework, PeopleSoft, SAP and Android/iPhone mobile platforms.

The is a home based position and the incumbent is expected to mainly work with teams based in Bangkok, New York, Valencia, etc. 

This is a UNOPS position and the incumbent is expected to support projects carried out for the United Nations Secretariat. The incumbent will be part of EAC – Asia under the full responsibility of UNOPS. 


Functional Responsibilities:The incumbent provides expertise in SAP Material Management (MM) process management, module configuration, and client support for mission business users.

Under  the direction of a Senior Project Manager, the incumbent is expected to undertake the following duties:
  • Conduct analysis for business process improvement;
  • Configure SAP material management module and validations;
  • Manage material master data;
  • Communicate with the business community with high level of client orientation and presentation skills;
  • Participate in mission trainings and deployments;
  • Frequent official mission travel is required
  • Perform other duties as may be reasonably required and in line with the incumbent’s scope of services above.
Monitoring and Progress Controls - Impact of results: 
  • Timely resolution of issues with high rate of business clients’ satisfaction
  • On time delivery of high-quality software with less defects introduced in the production environment
  • Timely delivery of properly configured modules aligned with the specifications, quality, and deadlines
  • Provision and updates of quality assurance standard operating manual
Education/Experience/Language requirements:Education
 
  • A Bachelor’s degree in computer technology, information management, mathematics, economics, business administration or other related field is required.
  • An advanced degree in the related field is desirable.

Work Experience

Required:
  • Minimum 2 years of progressively responsible experience in SAP process optimization and configuration in the area of material management (MM) or supply chain is required for a holder of a Bachelor’s degree in the relevant fields. A Master’s degree may substitute for some of the required years of experience. 
  • Knowledge and hands-on skills of SAP MM is required.

Desirable:
  • Experience in finance and control.
  • Knowledge of SAP master data management, configuration, process optimization quality assurance, and support activity, UN application architecture, integration with Siebel, or other UN standard platform.


Language
  • Fluency in written and oral English is required. 
  • Knowledge of another United Nations official language is an advantage.

Other
  • Frequent official mission travel is required
  • Knowledge of UN field operation, rations management are an advantage. 

For more details about the ICA contractual modality, please follow this link:
https://www.unops.org/english/Opportunities/job-opportunities/what-we-offer/Pages/Individual-Contractor-Agreements.aspx 

Application deadline: May 19, 2020.

Apply

About UNOPS

UNOPS is an operational arm of the United Nations, supporting the successful implementation of its partners’ peacebuilding, humanitarian and development projects around the world. Our mission is to help people build better lives and countries achieve sustainable development.

UNOPS areas of expertise cover infrastructure, procurement, project management, financial management and human resources.

Working with us

UNOPS offers short- and long-term work opportunities in diverse and challenging environments across the globe. We are looking for creative, results-focused professionals with skills in a range of disciplines.

Diversity

With over 4,000 UNOPS personnel and approximately 7,000 personnel recruited on behalf of UNOPS partners spread across 80 countries, our workforce represents a wide range of nationalities and cultures. We promote a balanced, diverse workforce — a strength that helps us better understand and address our partners’ needs, and continually strive to improve our gender balance through initiatives and policies that encourage recruitment of qualified female candidates.

Work life harmonization

UNOPS values its people and recognizes the importance of balancing professional and personal demands.

Background Information: Sustainable Development Cluster(SDC)

Based in New York, the Sustainable Development Cluster (SDC) supports diverse partners with their peacebuilding, humanitarian and development operations.

The SDC’s services include grants management, development and special initiatives support, and technology support to the UN and UN agencies.

The SDC is part of the New York Service Cluster that supports the United Nations Secretariat, as well as a broadening community of other New York-based United Nations organizations, bilateral and multilateral partners in the delivery of UNOPS mandate in project management, infrastructure management, and procurement management.

Benefits

  • Competitive Salaries
  • Work - Life Balance
  • up to 6 weeks paid annual leave
  • Awesome Colleagues
  • Diversity
  • Careers to contribute to achieve the SDGs
  • Intellectually challenging work assignments

items.title: Senior Salesforce Engineer (Work at Home) at Citizens Bank
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Senior Salesforce Engineer (Work at Home)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Banking, Financial Services, Financial Technology
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Public
Company: Citizens Bank – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time

Technologies

apex
visualforce
soql
salesforce

Job description

The Sr. Salesforce Engineer will assist in the development and ongoing maintenance of  Salesforce and Force.com applications and ensure the continued delivery of innovative, high quality solutions within a team oriented environment.

This role will work cross-functionally with a variety of areas in order to maximize the value Salesforce.com provides to the organization.  This includes understanding requirements, defining solution functionality, designing solutions, developing and maintaining solutions over time.  The Salesforce Engineer will be hands-on and have demonstrated experience developing and managing Salesforce.com in a diverse working environment.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Work collaboratively across teams and/or independently to design and build solutions on the Salesforce Force.com platform, including Web Services APIs, Apex, and Visualforce.  
  • Initially this candidate would be working closely with vendor resources to assist with and oversee vendor development activities.
  • Provide guidance on solution requirements, technical design, integration architecture, and solution recommendations.
  • Implement new enhancements including creation of custom objects, workflows, validation rules, approval processes, flows, flow triggers and email alerts.
  • Integrate Salesforce with other platforms, and develop and understanding of other key applications within the organization.
  • Implementation change control from development sandboxes to production and across the development lifecycle. Ensure that all necessary changes are documented, reviewed, tested, and approved before being deployed.
  • Develop reports, custom report types, dashboards, and processes to continuously monitor data quality and integrity.
  • Help guide and mentor other resources within the team as needed
  • Serve as a subject matter expert on items related to Salesforce.com, third party integrations, and AppExchange.
  • Remain current on new Salesforce features and functionality and providing recommendations for process improvements.
  • Possess a strong analytical and communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Prioritize tasks, manage time effectively and work on projects/activities in parallel.

Qualifications

Required Skills/Experience:

  • Minimum of at least five years of software development experience with Salesforce.com, with strong proficiency in Apex, Visualforce, and SOQL, and an in depth understanding of SFDC Profiles/Roles and Sharing Rules, Validation Rules, Tasks, Workflow rules, and Triggers, etc.
  • Extensive understanding of the Salesforce.com data model and how and when to create custom objects, junction objects, and other model items.
  • Experience with the Salesforce.com APEX data loader and other data loading tools.
  • Experience with Salesforce.com Web Services APIs - SOAP and REST-based Web Service APIs, including  consumption, request packaging, parsing\deserializing, managing static values, and UI\UX elements for working with data in returned API response payloads.
  • Demonstrated experience with integrating solutions between SFDC and external systems.
  • Detailed understanding of the Salesforce classic, Salesforce lightning and Salesforce sandbox platform development environments.
  • Experience in leading small teams of Engineers in delivering on full project development lifecyle is a plus. Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team oriented fast paced, dynamic environment, with an acumen for mentoring and growing team members
  • Experience with deployment/build/migration process in a Salesforce environment and associated tools
Preferred Skills/Experience:
  • Experience working in an agile delivery environment a plus.
  • Minimum Platform Engineer 1 Certificate and/or other Salesforce development certifications with Platform Engineer 2 preferred
Education, Certifications and/or Other Professional Credentials:
  • Bachelor's Degree required
  • Minimum Platform Engineer 1 Certificate and/or other Salesforce development certifications with Platform Engineer 2 preferred

Hours & Work Schedule

Hours per Week:  40
Work Schedule:  M-F, 8-5 pm

Why Work for Us

At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.

Equal Employment Opportunity

It is the policy of Citizens Bank to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.

Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran

Citizens Bank is a brand name of Citizens Bank, N.A. and each of its respective subsidiaries.

Apply

Benefits

  • Generous PTO
  • Flexible Work Schedules
  • Learning and Development Resources & Educational Assistance
  • Comprehensive Health Benefits
  • Volunteer Events & Corporate Match Program
  • Parental Leave for All Parents, Including Adoptive
  • Onsite Café & Coffee Bar (some locations)
  • Gym & Classes (some locations)
  • 401k Matching & Employee Stock Purchase Program
  • Discounts on Bank Services, Including Student Loan Refinancing

items.title: Salesforce Administrator
items.content:
Remote
  • REMOTE-US
  • ENGINEERING – ENGINEERING
  • FULL TIME- EXEMPT

Lambda School is on a mission to pioneer a new model of accessible higher education with no upfront costs and where the school invests in the students instead of the other way around. We are rethinking learning so that we can address the needs of both students and employers in tandem. We’re a progressive alternative to traditional college and fast track bootcamps. Lambda is an intensive program and an immersive live, online curriculum that teaches people the hard and soft skills they need to launch a new tech career. We offer both full time and part time courses to our students.

Lambda has successfully completed funding rounds with premier tier venture investors and we have students in almost every State across the United States. We’re looking for passionate, talented people who want to change the way the world thinks about higher education and unlock human potential, regardless of circumstance.

If that sounds exciting to you, let’s talk. Our success depends on building teams who can challenge each other’s assumptions with fresh perspectives. To that end, we don’t just accept differences – we celebrate them. Lambda School welcomes a diverse pool of applicants, including those from historically marginalized groups and non-traditional backgrounds who can appreciate the diverse student communities that we serve and are looking to grow into. This includes women, people with disabilities, people of color, formerly incarcerated people, individuals who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and/or gender nonconforming, first and second generation immigrants, veterans, and people from different socioeconomic backgrounds.

The Salesforce Administrator will lead the ongoing development of our salesforce.com environment. The successful candidate will have a record of success in improving processes and adoption using the Force.com platform. The administrator will work closely with functional leaders, organizational units, and subject matter experts to identify, configure, deploy, and maintain business processes.The Salesforce Administrator will be responsible for the executing on the day-to-day configuration, support, maintenance and improvement of our CRM platform.This is an exciting opportunity for a strong Salesforce Admin to support a complex and dynamic implementation within a fun, fast-paced, and growing organization.

What You’ll Do

  • Serve as primary system administrator for the Salesforce.com environment with approximately 100 users
  • Handle all basic administrative functions including user account maintenance, reports and dashboards, workflows and other routine task
  • Complete regular internal system audits and prepare for upgrades
  • Support data import and data cleansing activities
  • Work independently with stakeholders to define and document development requirements
  • Support end users with questions or system issues; work with leadership to track, prioritize and resolve any system bugs
  • Assist in training of new users, and grow the Salesforce.com skill set across the organization
  • Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and provide support related to third-party integrated apps and workflows as needed
  • A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
  • Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, customer-centric organization
  • Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
  • Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce.com and effectively balance user-requested functionality with long term platform stability and scalability

What You’ll Need

  • 2+ years of experience as a Salesforce.com administrator
  • Saleforce.com Admin (ADM201) certification is required
  • Marketing Cloud experience
  • Experience designing and implementing new processes and facilitating user adoption
  • Expert user of the Salesforce platform [ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, custom views, and other content of advanced complexity etc…]
  • Experience managing complex data
  • A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
  • A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements

Lambda School is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, genetic information, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, familial status, domestic violence victim status, veteran or military status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Lambda School is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. Please let us know if you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability.

Apply for job

items.title: Oracle Cloud Payroll Functional - Remote Work (3 months to hire). (Hillsborough)
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Oracle Cloud Payroll implementation as part of a larger HCM and ERP project. Customer is nearing payroll go-live this role is to assume leadership of a team already in place. There is a secondary objective to build a repeatable payroll conversion validation process.
Candidate needs to be experienced leading an Oracle Cloud Payroll Implementation project. Candidate needs strong client-facing communication skills. Ability to work onsite and remotely with Client Payroll Leads. Must have previous experience with Oracle Payroll Cloud implementation/support. Expertise in building reports using OTBI, data loads using HCM data loader and Payroll Batch Loader. Should be able to validate/correct HR data on employee/payroll records.

Must be self-motivated, self-starter, able to work independently and remotely.

Experience (must have):

At least 3 years of experience.
At least 2 years experience working with Oracle Payroll Cloud
Report development (OTBI)
Data load/conversion (HDL)

items.title: Salesforce Development – Release Supervisor
items.content:
Remote | High-paying
  • Job Type: Full-Time
  • Industry: Technology & Internet Services
  • Location: Remote
  • Specialism: Development
  • Pay: $120,000-$140,000
  • Ref: 1109236

Salesforce Development & Release Supervisor (100% REMOTE) – Perm – Remote – $120,000-$140,000

The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.

An Insurance Agency is seeking a Salesforce Development & Release Supervisor (100% REMOTE.)

Role Description

As the Salesforce Development & Release Manager, you play a key part in realizing our mission to provide customers with tools they love. Leverage your passion for technology, Salesforce, and creative ideas to develop amazing products for our customers and help define the vision, capabilities, and roadmap for our systems. You will lead a team of like-minded individuals by working with, directing, and supporting their efforts to deliver valuable products for our customers. This role has a wide variety of responsibilities, and in this environment, you can expect this role to grow and evolve – sometimes on a daily basis.

Skills & Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree strongly preferred. Relevant work experience (similar kind of work at a similar level of work as described in the essential duties) may be substituted for the bachelor’s degree. Completion of a degree is encouraged and supported
  • Salesforce experience, ideally with a focus on CI/CD
  • Experience managing teams, and providing leadership direction in an effort to promote a collaborative work environment
  • Must be flexible, innovative, and have the ability to perform in a rapidly changing, fast-paced environment
  • Must be able to clearly communicate in writing and verbally with all levels of individuals both internally and externally
  • Excellent communication skills, organizational skills and a high level of attention to detail
  • Strong technical aptitude within the Salesforce ecosystem, including experience developing on the platform
  • Experience and knowledge of DevOps standards, including source control tools, CI/CD, and overall ability to drive the software development life cycle
  • Willingness to jump in and help team members. No task is too big or too small.
  • Adaptability, flexibility and resourcefulness
  • Willingness to speak up, ask questions, offer feedback and suggestions to fellow team members
  • Able to prioritize and manage work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Be able to work with little direction and are okay with ambiguity as the projects may be changing
Apply for job

items.title: Salesforce Integration Architect at Formstack (Fishers, IN)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Salesforce Integration Architect

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Company: Formstack – Fishers, IN

Remote details

Office Location: Fishers, IN. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

salesforce
implementation

Job description

Formstack transforms the way you collect data and put it to work. 

We are looking for a Salesforce Integration Architect (Contract-to-Hire) to help us accomplish this mission!

Formstack is a 13-year-old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform. We are seeking people who demonstrate an ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse cultures and backgrounds.

Who You Are: 

You know how to deliver solutions to stakeholders that satisfy business requirements while setting the organization up for a scalable future, and consistently deliver results beyond expectations. You make solution recommendations based on your experience rather than blindly delivering requirements. You are a magician, a mind - reader, and a bit of a unicorn: able to take business requirements and see beyond them because you are driven by a vision of "the big picture". You are both customer and tech-savvy, able to collaborate with stakeholders and coworkers (across departments), and are a pro at prioritization. You work best in a fast-paced environment, but know when to give extra attention to important projects. You're serious about your work, but you don't take yourself too seriously - you're comfortable in a friendly and lively environment (and you might even have a couple dad jokes up your sleeve!). 

What You'll Do:

You will coordinate with multiple stakeholders to produce clearly defined requirements from multiple user stories that will allow the sales and finance departments end-to-end visibility of the customer revenue cycle. In addition, you'll deliver on those requirements within the timeframe agreed upon by the stakeholders.

How You Will Succeed: 

  • Collaborate with other stakeholders to understand the business needs and technical requirements behind multiple systems integrations. 
  • Ability to create and maintain API connections to be utilized by internal products.
  • Collaborate with Sales Operations Project Manager and VP of Finance to define, scope, and prioritize multiple requirements related to internal services needs
  • Help with SFDC APEX trigger maintenance and Openprise open API trigger maintenance 
  • Assist with opportunity creation from database events, control panel, and other database mappings 
  • Fulfill requirements to connect Zuora invoices to associated opportunities
  • Map Zuora rate plan charges with Salesforce Pricebook entries (for reporting purposes) 
  • Map custom Zuora fields on the account level to standard Salesforce account Objects 
  • Map relevant Zuora account fields to Bookings and Contract effective dates in Salesforce 
  • Implement the project scope by tracking progress to goal using JIRA tickets 

What We're Looking For: 

  • Must be fluent in written and spoken English
  • Open to contract-to-hire 
  • Familiarity with PHP, Node.js and Java (in order of priority) will be helpful
  • Experience connecting Zuora and Salesforce a plus
  • Consultant or Business Analyst experience a plus
  • Ability to collaborate and juggle/prioritize requirements from multiple stakeholders 
  • Prior experience in a customer-facing role 

What Formstack Offers:

  • Free health plans, as well as company-paid Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance Benefits for full-time employees.
  • Unlimited PTO for all employees
  • 401k with matching company contribution for full-time employees
  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job
  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning
  • Yearly company gatherings

Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? CLICK HERE to hear from some current Formstackers about what matters most!

Formstack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.

All data collected in our application process from resume collection to application questions is used for recruitment purposes only. We will store it in our applicant tracking system, JazzHR, and will not share this data with anyone else. We will keep your data until the role is filled and only continue to store it if we feel you may fit future roles.

Thank you for your interest in Formstack!

Apply

items.title: Salesforce Developer @ MAN
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
Salesforce Developer @ MAN

Company: Volkswagen Digital Solutions
Requires Work Permit
Language:
Full-stack Developer
Skills:
Must Have: CI/CD, SalesforceOther Required: Agile Methodologies
Skills:

Intro

The Volkswagen Group is forging ahead with digital transformation and Volkswagen Digital Solutions is part of this represented for its 3 tech units: AMS, MAN Digital Hub and SDC:LX.

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, autonomous driving, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the automotive industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution. Volkswagen Digital Solutions was created in Lisbon following the overall group strategy to be part of this challenge. 

MAN Digital Hub | Lisbon 
The MAN Digital Hub in Lisbon is part of Volkswagen Digital Solutions and, together with MAN Truck & Bus SE, develops and shapes the future of commercial vehicles by driving digitalization in this market. 

We are looking for passionate IT experts like you to join us in working on our Salesforce Platform together with our international team to build our mobility vision for tomorrow. 

What you will do…
  • Be a part of our Salesforce Center of Excellence; 
  • Build Salesforce applications and leverage the full capabilities of the Salesforce platform; 
  • According to your experience you will contribute to the growth of the team (e.g. mentoring, delivery, quality, …); 
  • Perform the operations in a DevOps model; 
  • Carrying out general application development activities including component tests, provision of codes for the development environment and technical documentation; 
  • Self-contained further education in the mentioned subject areas as well as assistance with cross and upskilling measures in the team. 

Main requirements

You have the following qualifications…
  • Bachelor's degree in IT and/or comparable job expertise; 
  • Good English skills, both written and spoken; 
  • Relevant salesforce platform development experience (min. 4 years for senior levels); 
  • Experience in using CI/CD tools like GitLab, Copado beneficial; 
  • Experience in using project management and collaboration tools like JIRA and Confluence; 
  • Willingness to work in an agile setup, to think outside the box and to help overcome roadblocks; 
  • Ability to solve problems in a creative way with high awareness for quality; 
  • Result-oriented and communicative team player. 

Benefits & Perks

What’s in it for you…
  • Be part of our amazing startup atmosphere and help of our local company culture, with the support of a solid international group; 
  • An Agile environment where your ideas are welcome; 
  • A very talented international team just as passionate and goal-oriented as you; 
  • Flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home if needed; 
  • The opportunity to evolve with continuous training and constant feedback; 
  • Access to Udemy; 
  • Health insurance for you and your family; 
  • Smartphone with voice/data plan; 
  • Fresh fruit, coffee and tea every day so you can be healthy and stay fueled for the day; 
  • Hakuna Matata Sessions aka our weekly knowledge sharing session with snacks and beer to kick-off the weekend.

items.title: (Senior) SAP-Commerce-Cloud-Entwickler ehem. Hybris (m/w/d) at Smart Commerce SE
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=33, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}

hiringOrganization.name: Smart Commerce SE – No office location

items.content:
(Senior) SAP-Commerce-Cloud-Entwickler ehem. Hybris (m/w/d)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: eCommerce
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Smart Commerce SE – No office location

Technologies

java
hybris
progressive-web-apps
spring

Job description

„Wir verstehen unsere Unternehmung als Ort, an dem Menschen zusammenkommen, um ein starkes gemeinsames Interesse und gemeinsame Werte zu teilen.“
Smart Commerce SE ist ein innovativer Anbieter von eCommerce-Lösungen. Unseren Erfolg verdanken wir in erster Linie unseren Mitarbeitern, die in Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden maßgeschneiderte eCommerce-Lösungen für den Online-Handel planen, bauen und betreiben.

Wir suchen ab sofort für unsere Standorte in Leipzig, Stuttgart Böblingen und Jena oder remote:

(Senior) SAP-Commerce-Cloud-Entwickler ehem. Hybris (m/w/d)

Du bearbeitest, eingebunden in ein interdisziplinäres Team, kontinuierlich bestehende und neue eCommerce Projekte inhouse sowie vor Ort bei unseren Kunden.

Deine Aufgaben:

  • Du entwickelst und wartest kundenspezifische Erweiterungen von SAP Commerce Cloud (ehem. Hybris) Installationen
  • Du machst Aufwandsschätzungen und definierst Arbeitspakete auf Basis vorliegender Anpassungen
  • Du führst technische Dienstleistungspakete durch
  • Du konfigurierst Entwicklungsumgebungen und CI-Systeme
  • Du erstellst technische Spezifikationen
  • In deine Verantwortung fallen ebenfalls objektorientierte Analyse, Design und Entwicklung
  • Abhängig von deinen Erfahrungen, die du mitbringst, führst du ggf.  ein Team von qualifizierten Softwareentwicklern und übernimmst die technische

Dein Profil:

  • Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare technische Qualifikation
  • Du bringst Berufserfahrung als Java-Softwareentwickler und Knowhow in IT-Architekturen mit
  • Du hast einschlägige Erfahrungen mit SAP Commerce Cloud B2C & B2B Commerce Kundenprojekten
  • Du bringst als Voraussetzung auch Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung mit Java Spring & J2EE mit
  • Auch hast du Kenntnisse in Commerce-Cloud-Accelerator oder in der Anbindung von SAP Commerce Cloud an SAP
  • Deine Deutsch- und möglichst auch Englischkenntnisse sind sehr gut in Wort und Schrift

Unser Angebot:

  • Individuell entwickeltes Weiterbildungsprogramm
  • Unternehmensbeteiligungen und Mitbestimmung bis in die höchste Unternehmensebene
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Möglichkeit zum Homeoffice
  • Teilzeitarbeitsmodelle für deine Work-Life-Balance
  • Lebensarbeitszeitkonto für Sabbaticals o.ä.
  • Individuelle Haustierlösungen
  • Arbeitsumgebung auf dem aktuellsten Stand der Technik
  • Ein sympathisches Team und Vorgesetze, die sich auf deine Ideen freuen
  • Regelmäßige Teamevents
  • Konsequente Anerkennung von Leistungen,
  • Beiträgen und Erfolgen
  • Innovative Projekte, unbürokratische Strukturen und kurze Entscheidungswege

Das erwartet dich:

The “Smart Way” - Gegenseitiges Vertrauen, Offenheit und Ehrlichkeit, Teamarbeit, die Verpflichtung zu Qualität und Exzellenz, Unabhängigkeit und Mitbestimmung sind feste Bestandteile des Smart Way. Diese Werte leiten unsere Mitarbeiter bei der Umsetzung der Unternehmensziele. Der Smart Way definiert wer wir sind und wie wir arbeiten, denken und handeln – er differenziert Smart Commerce am Markt und macht uns zu einem innovativen und besonderen Arbeitgeber.

Du hast Fragen? Unter 03641-3161030 beantwortet dir Evelin Linde, unsere HR Managerin, diese gerne!

Neugierig geworden? Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung mit Angabe deines Gehaltswunsches und deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

Du hast Interesse an der Stelle aber gerade keine Zeit für eine ausführliche Bewerbung? Kein Problem, Lass dich anrufen!
